author: Justice Nwafor
title: Embracing Regenerative Design: A Sustainable Future for Our Planet
text:
In an era where the echo of environmental urgency reverberates louder each day, a transformative wave is sweeping across industries, reshaping our interaction with our planet and its inhabitants. This wave, known as regenerative design, is not just a fleeting trend but a profound pivot towards a future where sustainability and wellbeing are not merely aspired to but actively achieved. The David E and Stacey L Goel Center for Creativity & Performance at Harvard University stands as a beacon of this movement, embodying the principles of regenerative design in its very architecture and purpose.
A New Paradigm in Design
At the heart of regenerative design lies the ambition to do more than simply reduce harm. Instead, this approach seeks to actively improve, restore, and rejuvenate our ecosystems, communities, and societal frameworks. The Goel Center, with its timber construction and flexible spaces, exemplifies how buildings can adapt and evolve, promoting not only environmental stewardship but also fostering creativity and collaboration among its inhabitants. This structure is a testament to how we can construct environments that thrive in harmony with nature, rather than at its expense.
Regenerative design transcends traditional sustainability by integrating the restoration of ecosystems, maximizing natural resources, and creating positive social impacts. From the drawing boards of architects to consumer product development, this holistic approach is gaining momentum, driven by the imperative to address our planet's climatic challenges head-on. It champions energy efficiency, low carbon materials, and most importantly, the preservation and enhancement of biodiversity and soil health.
Education, Legislation, and Beyond
Key to the widespread adoption of regenerative design is education in climate literacy and sustainable practices. Frameworks such as BREEAM and WELL, coupled with new legislation like the Biodiversity Net Gains, provide crucial guidance. However, there is a growing consensus that more comprehensive frameworks, such as the Living Building Challenge, are necessary to fully embrace the regenerative ethos. These frameworks not only set the bar for environmental performance but also underscore the importance of community wellbeing and cultural heritage preservation, essential components of a regenerative future.
The optimism for regenerative design's potential is palpable, with sectors across the board recognizing its value and viability. This is not just about adhering to new regulations but about a fundamental shift in perspective - from exploitation to stewardship, from consumption to contribution. Education and policy play pivotal roles in this transition, equipping professionals and communities with the knowledge and tools to implement regenerative practices effectively.
Living Examples of Regenerative Design
Playa Viva, an environmentally conscious resort, epitomizes regenerative design in action. Nestled on a pristine beach and surrounded by a rich tapestry of ecosystems, the resort is a living laboratory for sustainability and regenerative practices. It highlights how commerce and conservation can coexist, offering guests not just a stay but an immersive experience in harmony with nature. From nurturing wild turtle habitats to promoting farm-to-table cuisine, Playa Viva is a microcosm of what is possible when regenerative principles guide our actions.
The David E and Stacey L Goel Center for Creativity & Performance, through its innovative design and mission, along with initiatives like Playa Viva, illustrates that regenerative design is more than an abstract ideal. It is a tangible, actionable strategy that holds the key to a thriving future for our planet and its people. As these examples proliferate, they serve as beacons of hope, showing us the path towards a world where human activity not only coexists with nature but enriches it.
As we stand at this pivotal juncture in our relationship with the earth, the principles of regenerative design offer a roadmap to a future where environmental integrity and human wellbeing are inextricably linked. Through thoughtful design, enlightened education, and forward-thinking legislation, we can transition from mere inhabitants of this planet to its caretakers, ensuring a legacy of abundance and health for generations to come. In the end, regenerative design is not just about buildings or products; it's about redefining our collective ethos towards one of restoration, resilience, and rejuvenation.

author: VNExplorer
title: Pedro Martins exige mudança no Feirense: «Estou cansado de hipocrisias»
text:
Pedro Martins exige mudança no Feirense: «Estou cansado de hipocrisias»
Pedro Martins, técnico do Al-Gharafa, voltou a deixar duras críticas a Rodrigo Nunes, presidente do Feirense, bem como ao resto da estrutura do clube. O treinador lusitano afirmou, ainda, que estava na altura do dirigente máximo dos fogaceiros abandonar o barco.
«NÃƒÂ£o tenho qualquer ambiÃƒÂ§ÃƒÂ£o de ser presidente do Feirense ou de comprar a SAD. Como a maioria dos feirenses, estou muito preocupado com esta direÃƒÂ§ÃƒÂ£o do clube porque, em vez de solucionar os problemas, sÃƒÂ³ arranja mais problemas para o Feirense. EstÃƒÂ¡ na hora de mudar. Se surgir uma lista para as eleiÃƒÂ§ÃƒÂµes onde haja transparÃƒÂªncia, eu apoiarei essa listaÃ‚Â», referiu, numa entrevista ÃƒÂ RÃ¡dio Clube da Feira.
Questionado sobre a carta que escreveu anteriormente, criticando a decisão da direção de impedir os atletas profissionais de treinar e jogar no próprio estádio, o treinador abriu o livro: «Foi o presidente Rodrigo Nunes que fechou as portas, foi ele que não respeitou o legado do Feirense. Alguém perguntou à família do Marcolino Castro se concordava com esta decisão? Não, e eu sei que eles não concordaram. O Rodrigo Nunes diz que foram os sócios que votaram o fecho das portas, mas eu não tenho pachorra para isso e estou cansado de hipocrisias.»
«Isso nunca foi votado em Assembleia Geral. O que se votou foi que a direÃƒÂ§ÃƒÂ£o podia tomar medidas para que a SAD pagasse as dÃƒÂ­vidas, nenhum feirense sabia nem aceitaria o fecho das portas. A vida judicial era a ÃƒÂºnica forma de resolver o problemaÃ‚Â», rematou.

author: GB Times
title: Canʼt share story on Instagram?
text:
Can’t Share Story on Instagram? Troubleshooting Guide
Instagram has become an essential platform for sharing moments and connecting with others. One of the most popular features of Instagram is the ability to share stories, which are a series of photos and videos that disappear after 24 hours. However, many users have encountered issues when trying to share stories on Instagram. If you’re having trouble sharing a story on Instagram, this article will guide you through troubleshooting the problem.
Direct Answer: Can’t Share Story on Instagram?
If you’re unable to share a story on Instagram, the first step is to identify the problem. Here are some possible reasons why you can’t share a story on Instagram:
Insufficient Storage Space : If your device is running low on storage space, you may not be able to upload photos or videos to Instagram.
Outdated App : If your Instagram app is outdated, it may not function properly, causing issues with sharing stories.
Network Connection : A slow or unstable network connection can prevent you from sharing stories on Instagram.
Profile or Account Issues : Problems with your Instagram profile or account can also prevent you from sharing stories.
Troubleshooting Steps
To troubleshoot the problem, follow these steps:
Step 1: Check Your Storage Space Go to your device’s settings
Check the available storage space
Free up space by deleting unnecessary files or apps
Step 2: Update Your App Go to the App Store (for iOS devices) or Google Play Store (for Android devices)
Search for Instagram
Update the app to the latest version
Step 3: Check Your Network Connection Make sure your device is connected to a stable internet connection
Restart your device and try sharing a story again
Step 4: Check Your Profile or Account Issues Log out of your Instagram account and log back in
Check for any profile or account errors
Common Errors and Solutions
If you’re still having trouble sharing a story on Instagram, you may encounter one of the following errors:
Error 401: "Failed to load the camera" Solution: Restart your device and try sharing a story again
Error 502: "Invalid response from server" Solution: Check your internet connection and try sharing a story again
Error 503: "Failed to load media" Solution: Free up storage space on your device and try sharing a story again
Additional Tips
To avoid common issues when sharing stories on Instagram, follow these additional tips:
Use a Stable Internet Connection : Make sure your device is connected to a stable internet connection to avoid any connectivity issues.
Clear Cache and Data : Clear the cache and data of your Instagram app to ensure that it functions properly.
Disable Location Services : Disabling location services may help resolve issues with sharing stories.
Report the Issue : If none of the above steps resolve the issue, report the problem to Instagram’s support team.
Table: Common Issues and Solutions
Error
Cause
Solution
Error 401: "Failed to load the camera"
Device issues
Restart device and try sharing story again
Error 502: "Invalid response from server"
Internet connection issues
Check internet connection and try sharing story again
Error 503: "Failed to load media"
Storage space issues
Free up storage space on device and try sharing story again
Conclusion
Sharing stories on Instagram can be a seamless experience, but sometimes, technical issues can arise. By following the troubleshooting steps outlined in this article, you should be able to resolve the problem and start sharing stories again. Remember to check your storage space, update your app, and ensure a stable internet connection. Additionally, clearing cache and data, disabling location services, and reporting the issue to Instagram’s support team can also help resolve the problem.

author: CubaNet
title: Los triciclos eléctricos llegan a Matanzas para “aliviar” la crisis del transporte
text:
MIAMI, Estados Unidos. — La ciudad de Matanzas recibió en fecha reciente 15 triciclos eléctricos para paliar la grave crisis que enfrenta el transporte urbano, acrecentada con la escasez de combustible.
En declaraciones recogidas por la
Agencia Cubana de Noticias (ACN), José R. Curbelo Ojeda, secretario del sindicato de trabajadores de la Empresa Taxis Cuba en Matanzas, señaló que esos vehículos, ciento por ciento ecológicos, se desplazarán por las calles más transitadas de la ciudad diariamente, operando en un horario de 7:30 a. m. a 7:30 p. m., con un costo de 10 pesos por tramo.
Las rutas aprobadas para optimizar la cobertura tienen como punto de partida el preuniversitario José Luis Dubrocq. Tres de ellas abarcan los tramos Dubrocq-Reparto Armando Mestre y Dubrocq-Terminal de Ómnibus a lo largo de las calzadas de San Luis y Tirry, respectivamente. La cuarta ruta refuerza el trayecto Terminal de Ómnibus-Peñas Altas, según detalló Curbelo Ojeda.
Eugeny Rosario Castillo, chofer profesional de uno de los triciclos, aseguró a la ACN que la población está satisfecha con la nueva modalidad, destacando su confort y precio asequible.
Sin embargo, los conductores enfrentan un desafío al lidiar con la competencia, ya que la entrada en funcionamiento de los triciclos ha generado descontento entre aquellos que operan bicitaxis o coches de caballo, ahora relegados a un segundo plano por esta opción más práctica.
Amed Polo Gómez, residente en la urbe y usuario del nuevo servicio, dijo al medio oficialista que la iniciativa representa “una gran oportunidad para los ciudadanos comunes”, quienes, casi siempre, deben esperar períodos prolongados por un transporte estatal o se ven obligados a pagar precios elevados en el sector privado.
Los triciclos eléctricos fueron adquiridos en China a un precio cercano a los siete mil dólares y ensamblados en Cuba. Los primeros 10 se destinaron a la ciudad de Cárdenas.
Según la ACN, la nueva opción no solo ofrece una solución al transporte urbano afectado, sino que también impulsa la movilidad sostenible en la región.
Vehículos similares también han sido distribuidos durante los últimos meses en ciudades como
Artemisa.
El pasado lunes, el ministro del Transporte del régimen cubano, Eduardo Rodríguez Dávila, anunció la implementación de un
programa de electrificación del sector que busca aliviar la crisis actual.
Sigue nuestro canal de
Telegram.

author: PTI
title: Venugopal criticises BJP for ‘politicising’ Ram Temple consecration - The Hindu
text:
Amidst indecision within the party over accepting the invitation extended to its top leaders to attend the consecration ceremony of the Ram temple in Ayodhya, the Congress on Friday criticised the BJP alleging that the saffron party was turning the religious event into a party programme.
All India Congress Committee general secretary in charge of organisation K.C. Venugopal said that senior Congress leaders, including Sonia Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, had been invited to the consecration ceremony, and added that they would decide at an “appropriate time” whether to attend it.
Talking to reporters, Mr. Venugopal said the senior leaders had received personal invitations for the January 22 function. “They will take a stand on their own. It’s not a matter in which we have to express our opinion in public. They will take a stand when the time comes,” Mr. Venugopal said.
Clear stand He noted that the Congress party had a clear stand on such matters and it functioned accordingly. “We will express our stand after discussing in our party forums and take a decision,” he added.
Mr. Venugopal criticised the BJP government, asking “whether it was right to turn such an event into a function of a party or a government”.
Besides Ms. Gandhi and Mr. Kharge, the party’s leader in Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has also been invited.
The Ram temple in Ayodhya is scheduled to be inaugurated on January 22. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, and more than 6,000 people are expected to attend the ‘Pran Pratishtha’ ceremony.
